p: About 52% of the participants got health care services from government facilities that includes 10% services received from village-level community clinics ( Fig. 1). A substantial number of households got the service from unqualified providers, either village doctors (33%) or local drug stores (12%). About 65% of households were nearby (2 km radius) to remote rural government health care settings such as community clinics (28.5%) and union health centre (36.5%) ( Fig. 2).
